issues.details: The original 28-item peace framework was criticized for being too favorable to Russia, including ceding Donbas and reducing Ukrainian troops to 600,000.
Rubio stated he was unaware of the European countries' revision, raising questions about coordination between US and European partners.
She asserted that Ukraine's borders cannot be altered by force, challenging the notion of ceding Donbas to Russia.

responses.clarification: Rubio said he was unaware of the European proposal and had not received it.
Zelensky emphasized that any peace measures must be effective and implementable.
She clarified that Ukraine's borders cannot be changed by force.

evaluations.opinion: The European revision seeks to balance the original framework by maintaining Ukrainian troop levels and preserving the possibility of EU/NATO membership.
The meeting was described as the most productive in the overall peace process, but progress remains incomplete.

confirmed_facts: US and Ukraine held a meeting on 23 November 2025 to update the peace framework.
European countries (UK, France, Germany) prepared and sent a revision to the US.
Mark R. Rubio stated he was unaware of the European proposal.
Volodymyr Zelensky emphasized the need for effective and implementable peace measures.
Ursula von der Leyen stated that Ukraine's borders cannot be changed by force.
unconfirmed_allegations: Whether the revised peace framework will be accepted by all parties.
Whether Russia has agreed to the changes proposed by the European revision.

timeline.event: US and Ukraine held a meeting in Geneva to update the peace framework.
Announcement of the updated framework and ongoing work on joint proposals.
European countries sent their revision to the US.
Potential deadline for the peace process, subject to change.
